stories.headline: Sticker shocked
stories.summary: An analysis of Seattle's housing market reveals that despite rapid price increases in desirable neighborhoods, homes are more affordable now compared to the last 15 years due to rising incomes and lower interest rates.

stories.headline: Inmate imports
stories.summary: An investigative report detailing how private prisons in Tennessee are harboring a disproportionate number of violent criminals transferred from overcrowded Wisconsin facilities.

stories.headline: Neighborhood blight
stories.summary: An investigation into the effectiveness of housing inspections in St. Paul, revealing systemic issues in addressing repeat offenders of housing code violations.

stories.headline: Big Apple rents
stories.summary: A comprehensive analysis of New York City's rental market reveals a significant increase in median rents during the 1990s, although growth in income has kept pace.

stories.headline: Discarded and decayed
stories.summary: A report highlighting how lax property management by both private landlords and the government contributes to urban decay in Fort Wayne.

stories.headline: Second chances
stories.author_name: David A. Milliron and Chris Cantergiani
stories.summary: An analysis reveals that Georgia's 'first offender' law is frequently exploited, resulting in repeat offenders continuing to avoid criminal records.

stories.headline: Raving the wrong way
stories.summary: A critique of a Florida state report on designer drug deaths, uncovering inaccuracies that included irrelevant cases as evidence of an epidemic.
